dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 6668 IH: No Taxpayer Dollars for Communist China COVID Tests Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Harshbarger (for herself, Mr. Smith of New Jersey, Mr. Ogles, Mr. Van Drew, Mr. Norman, Mr. Jackson of Texas, and Mr. Dunn of Florida) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To prohibit the use of Federal funds to purchase at-home tests for SARS–CoV–2 from certain foreign entities.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Taxpayer Dollars for Communist China COVID Tests Act.

section.header: Prohibition on using Federal funds to purchase certain tests
section.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, no Federal funds may be used to purchase any at-home test for SARS–CoV–2 that is—

paragraph.text: manufactured, in whole or in part, in the People’s Republic of China;
imported from the People’s Republic of China; or
manufactured by any entity that is a subsidiary of a Chinese company.
